The universal communicator Untying the knots of digital interaction A dozen apps to connect with a dozen people entangles something perfectly natural: conversation. Entefy is untying the knots, using big ideas to create new technologies for digital communication – simplifying your interactions and creating space in your life to do more. ABOUT US You at the center Entefy is rewriting the code of digital interaction. Our universal communicator is a new tool for people-centric communication that puts you at the center of your hyper-connected world. It works on your favorite devices and gives you access to your digital universe whenever and wherever you need it. Entefy is built for the Internet of Things but designed for the Internet of People. OUR STORY In Short At Length Founders Entefy was born to rein in the growing chaos in communication and digital interaction. We are solving a pressing problem: the Internet generated a rush of amazing new technologies, then piled all these capabilities on our shoulders—a burden of devices, apps, protocols, web services, notifications. Something as innate as communication feels less and less instinctive. Entefy is not making an app for a demographic. We want to give anyone who communicates, anywhere on the planet, a new tool—a universal communicator —to unlock human potential and make connectedness natural again. The story of humankind is the story of interaction. Our ability to communicate allows ideas, traditions, and knowledge to build from generation to generation. From storytelling to the printing press, from the telegraph to the Internet, humankind's greatest inventions have always involved acquiring and transmitting information. To a degree never seen in human history, the proliferation of new technology is forcing near-daily changes in human behavior. Like air and water, interaction is ubiquitous, a constant presence. On any given day, 500 million thoughts are tweeted, 154 billion emails are composed, and 16 billion words are posted to Facebook. And we're not at any sort of peak. Not even close. These numbers are growing exponentially as more people globally join this hyper-connected world. The only thing in digital communication not growing is our capability for managing these interactions. But we've lost our way. There were no security backdoors in telegrams, no metadata breaches on the Pony Express, no ads embedded in smoke signals. In digital communication alone, people spend an average of 3 hours a day sending or reviewing messages, in part because our everyday conversations are distributed across a variety of devices, applications, formats, and operating systems. This fragmentation has forced us to accept inconsistency and inefficiency, not to mention unprecedented threats to privacy and security. All these devices and services represent wonderful improvements in point productivity. They let you do one particular thing better. But all these devices and services come at the expense of increased complexity. Standing amid a chaos of tools and messages and platforms and apps, the challenge before us is to manage this dynamic environment, to connect all of our communication channels in a way that enable a seamless conversation. Enter Entefy. We envision a future where communication is again natural and instinctive. Where technology serves us, and not the other way around. Where a new chapter in the human story can be written. Entefy's co-founders Alston and Brienne Ghafourifar have taken an idea originally sketched on a napkin and turned it into a fast-emerging technology company with development teams on two continents, a distinguished network of investors and advisors, and 31 filed patents protecting its groundbreaking solution. Alston serves as Entefy's CEO and brings to the company the curiosity of a social scientist and the precision of an engineer. In addition to leading the company's strategic direction, Alston heads the design and architecture of Entefy's universal communicator platform. He is also responsible for core inventions at the company and patent filings in the areas of communication, artificial intelligence, security, and cyber privacy. CORE VALUES Innovation Drive Curiosity Trust Agility The stories of humanity's most remarkable thinkers—Leonardo Da Vinci, Galileo Galilei, Alexander Graham Bell, Nikola Tesla, Richard Feynman—show that more than mere necessity drives innovation. And not just any innovation but rather courageous innovation. The rare breed of innovation born in difficult environments fraught with obstacles and yet succeeds for the benefit of all. Central to their diverse stories are traits like curiosity, drive, and trust in their own capabilities: Georgia O'Keefe began life in a rural Wisconsin farmhouse, receiving a limited and conventional artistic training. Yet through years of effort and practice, she developed a distinctive style that influenced Modernism while remaining perennially popular with the public. Thomas Edison is credited with more than 2,000 patents and dozens of inventions, but also led business ventures in mining, construction, and public utilities. Benjamin Franklin excelled as an inventor but was also a scientist, a businessperson, a publisher, an author, a diplomat—and a Founding Father. At Entefy, we are inspired by these extraordinary examples of curiosity, drive, and wonder. We believe that Entefy's inventions will mark an inflection point in the history of communication technology, a point in time when many strands come together. When innovation leads to meaningful improvement in people's lives. Persistence. Grit. Moxie. Call it what you want, you know it when you see it. Drive defines that rare person with a vision to upend a paradigm or improve our understanding of the world. We see this spirit in Marie and Pierre Curie's work. To test their theories, they needed the very rare compound radium chloride, which does not occur naturally in its pure state. So over four years, Marie Curie refined a ton of ore to isolate a mere 100 milligrams of the substance. Four years work for a few granules of material. But Marie found great satisfaction in the work: "We were very happy," Marie wrote. "We lived in a preoccupation as complete as that of a dream." This same drive was present in Thomas Edison's work: he tested hundreds of different filaments for his incandescent bulb before selecting bamboo. His famous adage that "Genius is one percent inspiration, ninety-nine percent perspiration" was well-grounded in reality. At Entefy, we are solving big, complex problems. We draw inspiration from those who have demonstrated rugged persistence to overcome immense obstacles. We constantly revisit, discard, rework. We do what it takes to get it just right. Richard Feynman, one of the preeminent physicists of the 20th century, was renowned for the breadth of his interests beyond the Physics for which he received his Nobel Prize. He taught himself the bongo drums, and took a crack at decrypting ancient Mayan inscriptions. He said in his autobiography, "I'm always looking, like a child, for the wonders I know I'm going to find." At Entefy, we feel the same way about the people and the world around us—limitless complexity so deep as to be awe-inspiring. We are excited to be working on intricate problems that defy easy resolution. We are motivated by sheer curiosity: What else can be discovered? There is magic out there still to be found. The causeway that links one person to another is trust. We see trust in the commitment of a handshake, and in our fidelity to people we never meet. Many of us engage in a collaborative exercise in trust every day: the commute. The average American adult gets behind the wheel 1,102 times a year, driving 10,600 miles over 280 hours. 210 million individuals and 253 million vehicles. Think of the potential risk inherent in driving a two-ton vehicle at 60 miles per hour at an oncoming vehicle just a dozen feet away. Driving is an exercise in trust. Trust in manufacturers, regulators, dealerships, and other drivers. We entrust our lives to our fellow citizens every day. At Entefy, we are motivated by trust in humankind in a shared future. We do not believe that a great product is built by one person, but generated by the collective efforts of a team. We trust each other, and extend that trust to the promise we make to our customers. We often think of "agility" in athletic : the grace of Baryshnikov or the wizardry of Michael Jordan. But agility encompasses intellectual flexibility as well. The economist John Maynard Keynes is famous for saying, "When my information changes, I alter my conclusions. What do you do, sir?" Generating innovation when technology is always changing, when our understanding of the world is always changing, requires mental flexibility to rival the physicality of a ballerina or the power of a sports legend. There have been countless technology revolutions, from landline telephones to smartphones, from manual-drive cars to self-driving cars, from snail mail to email, from bulky CRT TVs to LED flat screens. Entefy's technology advancement is yet another giant leap forward. Entefy lets you communicate with people, smart things, and services, easier, faster, smarter, and safer than previously imaginable. Digital interaction is at the core of our platform, so every industry can benefit from Entefy's universal communicator . That said, there are certain attributes that make Entefy especially valuable to particular industries. For example, industries dependent on high levels of communication, industries that collect and transmit large volumes of confidential data, industries where workers have a higher-than-average use of multiple applications, industries with high volumes of information sharing in complex environments, industries where employees are highly mobile, industries that are characterized by high levels of regulation – all of these are likely to especially benefit from Entefy. Entefy puts you at the center of your digital world by letting you access and manage people, smart things, and services in your life from a single application on all of your favorite devices. No more fooling around with multiple platforms, services, and protocols just to find when or where you promised to meet someone. No more hopping in and out of multiple apps to take care of mundane tasks. No more keeping track of dozens of passwords. No more searches that come up empty when you know the file is there (somewhere). And no more worries about the security of your personal data. In addition to all of this, Entefy's universal communicator puts the power of advanced AI in your hands. It works by unifying communications, search, smart things, contacts, and files, and seamlessly blends voice, pictures, audio, and text—all with perfect syncing across smartphone, tablet, laptop, and smart watch. However it is that you connect with your friends and colleagues, Entefy is your single platform for making your personal technology ecosystem simpler and easier. You've never seen anything like it. In fact, our ability to communicate is a large part of what defines humans and humanity. New technologies like smartphones and message apps have shown us the potential for new forms of communication, but their implementation has in large part done more to complicate people's lives than improve them. Entefy is creating the communication technologies that will bring us into a new era. We are rewriting the code of digital interaction to seamlessly connect people with everyone and everything in their lives. By building our universal communicator from the ground up and with a completely fresh vision, we are creating something so new and so universal, that the future will be changed for the better. Dramatically so. How do you know what users want? The idea for Entefy's universal communicator grew out of conversations between our sibling co-founders Alston and Brienne . They observed how their friends and the people around them were using technology, or rather, letting technology use them. From these observations grew a vision of universal impact, a path for improving the lives of nearly everyone. That vision has guided our actions since then. Communication is about people, so we work closely with future users to ensure we are designing a product that makes a difference. We test our assumptions again and again—we survey, we interact with users, we run trials with advisors and investors. For example, we recently conducted a confidential survey among 1,500 U.S. professionals regarding their communication and digital interaction requirements. We were pleased to discover that 95.6% of these users were interested or very interested in using an offering that included the attributes of Entefy. Can Entefy keep my data secure? Entefy considers privacy and security to be central to the user experience. It is unavoidably the case that the more information Entefy has about the user, the more useful Entefy is to the user. It is also the case that different users have different preferences and therefore make different trade-off choices between convenience and security. Recognizing this, Entefy has designed the universal communicator so that you, the user, can make the decisions about what level of security and data access is most appropriate. And you can make these decisions dynamically to apply the correct level privacy and security to the particular situation. It is important to note that we have architected our system in such a fashion that Entefy maintains very little customer data. Between enabling customer choice and designing the system with security in mind from the ground up, we are able to deliver remarkable services with unprecedented security and privacy. Standing amid a chaos of tools and messages and platforms and apps, the challenge before us is to manage this dynamic environment, to connect all of our communication channels in a way that enable a seamless conversation. Enter Entefy. We envision a future where communication is again natural and instinctive. Where technology serves us, and not the other way around. Where a new chapter in the human story can be written. CORE VALUES Innovation Drive Curiosity Trust Agility The stories of humanity's most remarkable thinkers—Leonardo Da Vinci, Galileo Galilei, Alexander Graham Bell, Nikola Tesla, Richard Feynman—show that more than mere necessity drives innovation. And not just any innovation but rather courageous innovation. The rare breed of innovation born in difficult environments fraught with obstacles and yet succeeds for the benefit of all. Central to their diverse stories are traits like curiosity, drive, and trust in their own capabilities: Georgia O'Keefe began life in a rural Wisconsin farmhouse, receiving a limited and conventional artistic training. Yet through years of effort and practice, she developed a distinctive style that influenced Modernism while remaining perennially popular with the public. Thomas Edison is credited with more than 2,000 patents and dozens of inventions, but also led business ventures in mining, construction, and public utilities. Benjamin Franklin excelled as an inventor but was also a scientist, a businessperson, a publisher, an author, a diplomat—and a Founding Father. At Entefy, we are inspired by these extraordinary examples of curiosity, drive, and wonder. We believe that Entefy's inventions will mark an inflection point in the history of communication technology, a point in time when many strands come together. When innovation leads to meaningful improvement in people's lives. Persistence. Grit. Moxie. Call it what you want, you know it when you see it. Drive defines that rare person with a vision to upend a paradigm or improve our understanding of the world. We see this spirit in Marie and Pierre Curie's work. To test their theories, they needed the very rare compound radium chloride, which does not occur naturally in its pure state. So over four years, Marie Curie refined a ton of ore to isolate a mere 100 milligrams of the substance. Four years work for a few granules of material. But Marie found great satisfaction in the work: "We were very happy," Marie wrote. "We lived in a preoccupation as complete as that of a dream." This same drive was present in Thomas Edison's work: he tested hundreds of different filaments for his incandescent bulb before selecting bamboo. His famous adage that "Genius is one percent inspiration, ninety-nine percent perspiration" was well-grounded in reality. At Entefy, we are solving big, complex problems. We draw inspiration from those who have demonstrated rugged persistence to overcome immense obstacles. We constantly revisit, discard, rework. We do what it takes to get it just right. Richard Feynman, one of the preeminent physicists of the 20th century, was renowned for the breadth of his interests beyond the Physics for which he received his Nobel Prize. He taught himself the bongo drums, and took a crack at decrypting ancient Mayan inscriptions. He said in his autobiography, "I'm always looking, like a child, for the wonders I know I'm going to find." At Entefy, we feel the same way about the people and the world around us—limitless complexity so deep as to be awe-inspiring. We are excited to be working on intricate problems that defy easy resolution. We are motivated by sheer curiosity: What else can be discovered? There is magic out there still to be found. The causeway that links one person to another is trust. We see trust in the commitment of a handshake, and in our fidelity to people we never meet. Many of us engage in a collaborative exercise in trust every day: the commute. The average American adult gets behind the wheel 1,102 times a year, driving 10,600 miles over 280 hours. 210 million individuals and 253 million vehicles. Think of the potential risk inherent in driving a two-ton vehicle at 60 miles per hour at an oncoming vehicle just a dozen feet away. Driving is an exercise in trust. Trust in manufacturers, regulators, dealerships, and other drivers. We entrust our lives to our fellow citizens every day. At Entefy, we are motivated by trust in humankind in a shared future. We do not believe that a great product is built by one person, but generated by the collective efforts of a team. We trust each other, and extend that trust to the promise we make to our customers. We often think of "agility" in athletic : the grace of Baryshnikov or the wizardry of Michael Jordan. But agility encompasses intellectual flexibility as well. The economist John Maynard Keynes is famous for saying, "When my information changes, I alter my conclusions. What do you do, sir?" Generating innovation when technology is always changing, when our understanding of the world is always changing, requires mental flexibility to rival the physicality of a ballerina or the power of a sports legend. Entefy is solving complex technological problems that have resisted resolution for years. Our first ideas are not always our best, but we backtrack and rework and reexamine our assumptions.
